title: How to Do a Euro Step Layup (Basketball)

steps.title: Start by dribbling the ball on the left side of the floor and basket.
steps.content: Start by dribbling the ball on the left side of the floor and basket.

steps.title: Dribble with your left hand towards the basket.
steps.content: Dribble with your left hand towards the basket. When you start the dribble you want to push the ball out in front of you to get a quick start. Be sure not to push it out too far or the ball will get stolen.

steps.title: Wait until you get about 3-5 feet away from the basket.
steps.content: Wait until you get about 3-5 feet away from the basket. Then pick the ball up as you are planting your right foot. This should take anywhere from 1-3 dribbles depending on skill level. 3 at the max. Traveling is taking more than 2 steps without dribbling the ball so make sure you pick the ball up as you plant your right foot about 3-5 feet from the basket.

steps.title: Step with your left foot.
steps.content: Step with your left foot. Your left foot is going to be the foot you jump off of, like a normal right handed layup on the right side.

steps.title: Have the ball in your right hand when you jump.
steps.content: Have the ball in your right hand when you jump.

steps.title: Swing your right leg up as you bring your arm up.
steps.content: Swing your right leg up as you bring your arm up. Move as if they are connected with a string from your elbow to your knee.

steps.title: Wait until the peak of your jump.
steps.content: Wait until the peak of your jump. There, push the ball off the glass and into the basket. You want to aim in the middle of the square not the left side.

steps.title: Start by dribbling the ball at the top of the 3 point line straight away from the basket.
steps.content: Start by dribbling the ball at the top of the 3 point line straight away from the basket.

steps.title: Continue dribbling as you run towards the basket.
steps.content: Continue dribbling as you run towards the basket. Start off slow and then pick up your speed as you get the hang of it.

steps.title: Wait until you are about 5 feet from the basket.
steps.content: Wait until you are about 5 feet from the basket. Then take a right footed step while picking up the ball. You want to make this step to your right, making it seem like you are going to the right side.

steps.title: Push off your right foot step with your left foot, back to the left side of the basket.
steps.content: Push off your right foot step with your left foot, back to the left side of the basket. You want to act like you are faking out a defender by going to the right and then quickly going to the left side.

steps.title: Jump off of your left foot like you are doing a normal right handed layup on the right side.
steps.content: Jump off of your left foot like you are doing a normal right handed layup on the right side. Swing your right leg and your right knee up as you bring your right arm up. Bring your leg and arm up at the same time like a string is connected from your elbow to your knee.

steps.title: Have the ball in your right hand.
steps.content: Have the ball in your right hand. Put it up off the glass in the middle of the square and in the basket. Depending on the angle you have to put the ball off the glass you might have to put some spin on the ball by twisting your wrist to the left.
